headers.subject: [tosdr:3186] Twitter [bad] Right to access

html:
(Trying this again, image in previous post didn't work) Under current European law, users/data subjects have the right to access their personal data which the controller has collected (art. 12 Directive 95/46/EC, http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:31995L0046:en:HTML) and ask for a copy of those personal data. Twitter makes it very hard for users to access their personal data, because they are required to send a fax with various (personal) data to Twitter for identification purposes. It's pretty obvious that most people don't have faxes at home anymore.

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
---

subject: Twitter [bad] Right to access
text:
<https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-e639t2akYOs/VAYM_IHKX_I/AAAAAAAAAAk/iyVk5BKNwg8/s1600/twitter%2Bright%2Bto%2Baccess.jpg>
(Trying this again, image in previous post didn't work) Under current 
European law, users/data subjects have the right to access their personal 
data which the controller has collected (art. 12 Directive 95/46/EC, 
http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:31995L0046:en:HTML) 
and ask for a copy of those personal data. Twitter makes it very hard for 
users to access their personal data, because they are required to send a *fax 
*with various (personal) data to Twitter for identification purposes. It's 
pretty obvious that most people don't have faxes at home anymore.

--
